content.description: This route climbs the intermittent crack system just left of Claim Jumper, and features low-quality rock similar to climbing a vertical coral reef.  Sharp and dirty at this time.  Start up the crack, and at the ledgy break work through one difficult move to the anchors.
Another one of those "hard start, easy finish" routes at Wild Iris.  Begins on small holds with a couple difficult clips leading up to bigger pockets.
content.location: Around the corner to the right of Annie Git Yer Drill and left of Greenhorns In Velvet.  The bottom of Miner's gets shade almost all day.

content.description: Start on blunt arÃªte behind a small pine tree. Climb up on easy moves to a short but noticeable crux on the face above.
content.protection: 6 bolts to anchors \ Pig Tail lower-off's

content.description: A great combination of pockets and slab.  Don't miss the shell fossil at waist level right at the start.
content.location: This climb is on the face around the right of the main alcove of the Claim Jumper wall.  It's obscured by, and slightly to the right of a big tree close to the wall.

content.description: This strenuous route follows a right leaning flake system with laybacks and jamming.  The feet are poor in this section, so good body tension is required.  The crack system deposits you into some face climb above.  The crux of the climb is finding go positions to clip the bolts in the flake section.
content.location: This climb begins where the main trail meets the cliff line.

content.description:
slightly harder than its neighbor to the right, and easier than the route on its left. This relatively easy route adds to the natural progression in difficulty, right to left, for this wall.

Note: For those that the (completely safe), anchor on "Lever Action" makes them feel "a little thin in the lining", you can easily choose the anchor for this route.
content.location: 10 feet right of "Green Horns in Velvet" or 10 feet right of "Lever Action"

content.description: This popular route start near the where the main leads to the base of the cliff.  This climb has enjoyable crack moves at the bottom and generic pocket and face climbing at the top.  A fun route.
content.location:
The main trail that passes White Buffalo leads to the base of the route.  It is the first route to the right of

Claim Jumper

.

pathTokens: 2. Central (Blooming Rose, Claim Jumper, Saddle Tramp)
